page.title: 08FARMS NEAR BRIGG
page.content: There are nine farm sites. Some are part of larger concerns, or are on more than one site, with shared labour and machinery. Most farms had betwen three and six tractor units, with varying supplementary machinery depending on soil type or crop. { {Acreage}varied from seven to seven hundred and fifty acres. {Soil types were mixtures of deposits of sand and medium loam, overlapping with heavy boulder clay. Most farms are about { {9O% arable. }Crops grown are wheat, barley, oilseed rape, sugar beet, peas, potatoes, with some grass grown largely as a cash crop. Livestock are noticeably secondary to arable farming. Two farms keep l2O - 35O ewes, another had 70 bulls and 40 geese.Visits to the stockmarket seem infrequent,but occur mostly in early summer to sell lambs.
